headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; Be Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. SAD RAILROAD ACCIDENT. SON OF GEN. PIERCE KILLED. Narrow Escape of the President Elect.

docs.lead_paragraph: News has just been received here of a terrible accident on the Boston and Maine Railroad, one mile north of Andover. Several persons were severely injured, and the only child of Gen. PIERCE was killed. The train left Boston at 124 o'clock.
docs.abstract: On the Concord Road - Son of Gen Pierce killed
docs.snippet: News has just been received here of a terrible accident on the Boston and Maine Railroad, one mile north of Andover. Several persons were severely injured, and the only child of Gen. PIERCE was killed. The train left Boston at 124 o'clock.

headline.main: HISTORICAL SOCIETY LECTURES.; The City of New-York-Its Growth, Destinies and Duties. LECTURE BY HON. JOHN A. DIX.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Fourth Lecture of the Series before the New-York Historical Society was delivered last evening, at Metropolitan Hall, by lion. JOHN A. DIX. The audience in attendance was large and highly respectable. Hon. LUTHER BRADISH presided, and introduced to the assembly Mr. DIX, who spoke substantially as follows:

headline.main: Offer of a U. S. Vessel to Hon. W. R. King.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following correspondence relative to the offer of the U. S. steamer Fulton, to convey Mr. KINO to Havana, will be found of interest: NAVY DEPARTMENT, Thursday, Dec. 30, 1852. MY DEAR SIR: I have learned that it is your purpose to make a voyage to Cuba, for the benefit of your health, which, I regret to hear, is so much impaired as to render this necessary. headline.main: BOARD OF ALDERMEN.; Proceedings of Wednesday Night's Session.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board met on Wednesday evening pursuant to adjournment. Upon the roll being called a ?? having answered to their names, the minutes of the pro?? meeting were read and approved.

headline.main: FRANCE.; Emperor's Pay-Personal Appearance--Political News--Spanish Politics--General Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senatus Consultum, fixing the amount of the civil list and the dotation of the crown, has been promulgated. The civil list is 25,000,000 francs. The dolation is composed of the same royal palaces, forests and manufactories, the furniture, museums and crown jewels which belonged to the crown under the Monarchy and Empire NAPOLEON'S right of property in and administration of these possessions, are qualified by restrictions similar to those of the Monarchy.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: The Treatment of Convicts and their Families.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is a state within the bounds of Christendom, where the crime of a man is visited upon his harmless wife and dependent children.
docs.snippet: There is a state within the bounds of Christendom, where the crime of a man is visited upon his harmless wife and dependent children.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following letter, which we received last evening from our distinguished Senator in Congress, will be read with interest, and by a vast many of his constituents, with profound regret: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31. 1852. SIR--My object in addressing you, as the conductor of a public press, is to make known a purpose, which has long been avowed by me, of withdrawing from public life.

headline.main: XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session.; SENATE. XXXIId CONGRESS.. Second Session. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MALLORY appeared to day. Mr. BADGER offered a resolution continuing the employment of a Clerk to the President of the Senate. He said the adoption of the resolution would be gratifying to the late president of the Senate (Mr. KING), who was now on account of ill health leaving our shores. The resolution was adopted. pted.

headline.main: The Vacant U. S. Jadgeship--Appointments--Mr. King's Health. &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President today sent to the Senate the nomination of lion. GEO E. BADGER, of North Carolina, to the vacant Judgeship of the Supreme Court. The Secretary of the Treasury has appointed WILLIAM MILLER, Inspector of Steamboat hulls, and S. C. WARD, Inspector of Boilers at New-London, Conn.; NATIIANIEL NASH, Inspector of Hulls, and GARRETT B. DAVIES, Inspector of Boilers at Norfolk, Va., at salaries of $300 each.
